> I don't think it will happen in a big bang either. It will happen in
> particular solution segments first. Then there will be some bleedover.
> Then certain winners will emerge from the tagwars.

I'm with you on that. We'll see data formats and semantic standards in 
disparate industry segments.  What I doubt is that will then somehow 
amalgamate together into one massive glop of semantic goodness, where anyone 
can talk to anyone, automagically.  Just don't see it.

Love the "tagwars" term.  LOL

One of the things that is attractive about using Atom/APP for enterprise 
integration (specifically between disparate enterprises, where one can't 
dictate to the other) is it's very simplicity. Easy to implement and get a 
prototype running to show value.  Then not too hard to extend to provide more 
ROI.  I've always preferred evolutionary approaches to tough integration 
issues.  Crawl, Walk, Run.  

If you believe the WS-GLOP vendors, they'll get you to hypersonic, 
interstellar speed, skipping the more prosaic crawl/walk/run stages. Problem 
is, the only thing that shows that kind of exponential path in that scenario 
is the vendor's bank account. ;-)

Andrzej Jan Taramina
Chaeron Corporation: Enterprise System Solutions
